column7: Survey of U.S. history from the end of the Civil War to the present, focusing on struggles to achieve a multiracial democracy, the evolution of an industrial, urbanized, and pluralistic society, the intersections between domestic and global affairs, and the practice of historical interpretation. Epoch-making events and elites are considered in light of their relation to the activities and lives of ordinary people, including people of color, immigrants, women, and the working and middle classes. Credit is not given for both HIST 172 and HIST 173.
column9: Credit is not given for both HIST 172 and HIST 173.
column10: Humanities - Hist & Phil, and Cultural Studies - US Minority course.
column11: Students must register for one discussion and one lecture section.
